long: Meaning: a "man" as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation).  Usage: also, another, any (man), a certain,   champion, consent, each, every (one), fellow, (foot-, husband-) man, (good-, great, mighty) man, he, high (degree), him (that is), husband, man(-kind),   none, one, people, person,   steward, what (man) soever, whoso(-ever), worthy. Compare "H802".  Source: contracted for "H582" (or perhaps rather from an unused root meaning to "be extant");
